title: Machine Learning-Based Energy Efficiency Optimization Design for Arid Climate Dome Structures

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational architectural design skills, basic thermodynamics concepts, proficiency in parametric modeling tools (Rhino/Grasshopper), and understanding of energy simulation
context.additional_context: Focuses on practical skill acquisition for working professionals, with hands-on practice using digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Development of a multivariate polynomial regression (MPR) model to predict the thermal performance of dome structures in arid climate conditions.
Energy efficiency simulation of a composite cladding system (polycarbonate + aluminum) using parametric tools.
Application of an optimization design process considering both energy and material costs.
Implementation of an optimized hybrid cladding ratio (10% polycarbonate + 90% aluminum) in actual design cases.

resources: Parametric Modeling Software (Rhino 7, Grasshopper, Honeybee Plugin)
Energy Simulation Dataset (Based on Arid Climate Regions)
Optimization Algorithm Learning Materials (Genetic Algorithm, Multivariate Polynomial Regression)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
